{"step_by_step_thinking": "Down syndrome is characterized by specific facial features. According to Document 17, typical craniofacial features of Down syndrome include midfacial hypoplasia, which means underdevelopment or incomplete development of the midface. This is also confirmed in Document 3, which mentions deficiency in the midfacial area in individuals with Down syndrome. Prognathism, on the other hand, refers to the jutting out of the lower jaw (mandibular prognathism) or the upper jaw (maxillary prognathism). Retrognathia refers to the receding of the jaw. These are not mentioned as typical features of Down syndrome in the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "D. Maxillary hypoplasia"}
